effect.name: Light Graffiti
effect.description: Light Graffiti effect. This effect allows one to do Light Painting (i.e. painting with light sources on a photo by keeping the shutter opened for a while), but for video.
effect.author: Simon A. Eugster (Granjow)

parameter.name: thresholdBrightness
Brightness Threshold
parameter.comment:
How bright (R+G+B) does a pixel need to be in order to be recognized as a light source?
Increasing this threshold requires brighter light sources (i.e. more white or less color, respectively) but prevents some «false alarms» where semi-bright parts, e.g. hands where colors can change quite a lot compared to the background, are incorrectly recognized as light source.

parameter.name: thresholdDifference
Difference Threshold
parameter.comment:
How much does the strongest color channel of a pixel have to change, compared to the background image (max(dR, dG, dB)), in order to be recognized as light source?
Increasing this threshold makes it harder for light sources to be accepted on bright backgrounds, but decreases the danger of noise or generally bright spots counting as light source.

parameter.name: thresholdDiffSum
Difference Sum Threshold
parameter.comment:
How much does the sum of all color channels relative to the background image (dR + dG + dB) have to change until a pixel is recognized as a light source?
Raising this value might, in some cases, avoid that some light objects lit by the light source are added to the light mask.

parameter.name: sensitivity
Sensitivity
parameter.comment:
Light sensitivity.
For slowly moving light source try to use a lower sensitivity to obtain a better exposure.

parameter.name: lowerOverexposure
Lower Overexposure
parameter.comment:
Lowers overexposure.
The light mask does not get white immediately when the light source is moving slowly or staying steady.

parameter.name: dim
Dimming
parameter.comment: Dims the light mask. Lights will leave a fainting trail if it is set to a value > 0.

parameter.name: backgroundWeight
Background Weight
parameter.comment: Strength of the (calculated) background image. Setting it to 100 paints the light mask directly over the background, without the painting person in the image if the video starts with a «clean» background image. (See the α parameter.)

parameter.name: longAlpha
α
parameter.comment:
Determines how the effect tries to adapt to background changes.
The Light Graffiti effect remembers the first frame of the clip it is applied to, so the clip should always start with the painter outside of the video. If the background constantly changes, e.g. on a street, try to set α > 0 to calculate an average background image.

parameter.name: saturation
Saturation
parameter.comment: Increases the saturation of lights.

parameter.name: statsBrightness
Show brightness statistics
parameter.comment:
The stats switches allow easy and accurate adjustment of the threshold parameters.
Example: To adjust the brightness threshold, check this box and adjust the threshold until the whole light source is highlighted. Repeat the same with the other parameters. Only parts that are highlighted in all thresholds will count as light source.

parameter.name: transparentBackground
Transparent Background
parameter.comment: Makes the background transparent, allowing to apply a composite effect and paint the light mask over a completely different video.

parameter.name: nonlinearDim
Nonlinear dimming
parameter.comment: If normal dimming does not look natural enough, try this one.

parameter.name: reset
Reset
parameter.comment: Resets the light mask and the background image. This is necessary e.g. if you apply this effect to a clip in the timeline and then move the timeline cursor from outside of the clip to the middle of it. The effect receives this frame in the middle as first frame and uses it as background image. For proper threshold adjusting move the timeline cursor to the beginning of the clip, check the Reset box and uncheck it again.
